intro: Hibbertia acrotrichion, commonly known as the rough-hairy hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as South Australia and Western Australia. Hibbertia acrotrichion has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
